content.description: Looks like it's loose and chossy, it's actually much better than it looks. This is a nice fun jug haul.

Oral tradition says this was the first route put up at Birdsboro. Walking along the trail, you see it jump out as the cleanest looking face climb in the quarry. 

  I started to the lower left of the face in a corner and then moved right to the face around to get to the first bolt. From there I stuck to the face, even though the arete or cracks near it were within reach. Instead I stuck to the thin, horizontal cracks/features on the mostly blank face.
Technical balancy start.  Pass bolts to a ledge, clip another bolt then make the crux move to the anchors.
content.location: Zorro Face, about 30 feet to the left (look up for the red face).
Right of Jenga, just past the rockfall area

climbs.name: Liken' the Lichen
climbs.fa: Bolted by Andrew Messick. FA Matthew Bacalakis

content.description: True to its name, very dirty route covered in grime.
Climb straight up blocky holds past 5 or 6 bolts to anchors.  Pretty consistent grade most of the way up. Didn't feel like there was a crux.
content.location: Far left side of Zorro area, about 15 feet right of Geronimo.  Looks like Jenga's little brother.

content.description: Starts is right of the zorro corner, follow the bolt line to the roof, clip the bolt below the roof and pull to one more bolt and then the anchors
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts up to anchors with rap rings.
content.location: This route is right of the zorro corner.

content.protection: Sport slings on bolts.best to extend tr anchors as regular draws may sit on rock edge

content.description: Climb the face to the right of "Sandra's Climb".
content.location: directly to the right of "Sandra's Climb".

content.description: Tricky little roof. Short, fun climb.  Just around the corner from Zorro Face.

climbs.name: Face is Great - Choss is Off

content.description:
Good climb, well bolted. Good rest spots. Because you could potentially deck from the second bolt, this might not be great for a new leader.

 Using different lines and the same three bolts, variations can include from 5.6 to 5.11 moves.
content.location: Zorro Face, between Zorro and Face O Meter.

content.description:
Nice intermediate face climb on good ledges, with a small roof and tricky throw to pull said roof.  Using your hands (maybe feet?) beyond the arete to the left is surely off.  This route shares the third bolt and anchors with Clown Shoes (hence the name).  Climber can bail out to clown shoes if necessary after the first bolt.

 Climb up the easy, low angle base and make your way up to the horizontal crack and underclung mini roof.  Use the arete after clipping the second bolt far to your right and throw up to some more good ledges before making the third clip to the shared bolt.  Climbing eases up as it shares the finish with Clown Shoes to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 anchors with rap rings (3rd bolt and anchor shared with Clown Shoes)
content.location: On Zorro wall between the arete crack (left) and the prow and roof that is Face O Meter.

content.description: Crux is at the second bolt. Stay on the line for the 5.7 moves as there are easy ledges to the left.    Or the crux is at the fourth bolt if you are shorter (in wing span). Stem your left foot out to gain a needed inch to clip high.   Nice belayer's tree on the ground.
content.location: Directly left of Sandra's Climb, which is left of Geronimo (the prominent steep face that stands apart from the cliff).Rope drag happens on descent. Consider to rappel.
